campaign.story:
*desperately* click! click!
Thirsty Sword Lesbians battle the Lady of Chains when her enforcers march down from the frosty north. They rocket through the stars to safeguard diplomats ending a generations-old conflict. They sip tea together and share shy glances at the corner cafe with their old classmates and comrades. Even when swords are crossed, they have the potential to connect more deeply than anyone expects.
A sword duel can end in kissing, a witch can gain her power by helping others find love, and an entire campaign can be built around vagabond matchmakers piloting their sentient gay spaceship from system to system.
If you love angsty disaster lesbians with swords, you have come to the right place.
Thirsty Sword Lesbians by April Kit Walsh is a roleplaying game that celebrates the love, power, and existence of queer people—specifically queer people with swords and a lot of feelings. Flirting, sword-fighting, and barbed zingers all mix together in a system designed for both narrative drama and player safety. This innovative take on the Powered by the Apocalypse engine is a breeze to learn and ensures that no matter how the dice fall, something interesting happens to move the story forward.
In this game, you will solve problems with wit, empathy, and style, fight when something is worth fighting for, and redeem (or seduce) at least a few of your adversaries. You’re part of a community that embodies important ideals and you’ll strive to protect it and make your world better.
Play as one of nine character types: Beast, Chosen, Devoted, Infamous, Nature Witch, Scoundrel, Seeker, Spooky Witch, and Trickster. Each explores a particular emotional conflict that drives the drama and shapes your character’s story. Are you a Beast, faced with the dilemma of expressing your inner truth versus fitting in to a society that demands you conform? A Devoted, who sacrifices for others while struggling to care for yourself? A Trickster, who craves closeness but fears vulnerability? In long-term play, you may even resolve your initial arc and advance into a different playbook as you continue to change and grow, facing new challenges.
Backers get immediate access to the playbooks too. They're form fillable!
Thirsty Sword Lesbians provides clear, robust guidance and support for running the game, including how to make appealing adversaries, set the tone, structure play, and create a safe environment at the table. Handy reference sheets help you narrate appropriate twists and drama on the fly, depending on the feelings and character types you have in play.
Want to jump into a one-shot? The game includes six adventures that can stand alone or kick off a longer series: Sword Lesbians of the Three Houses, Best Day of Their Lives, Constellation Festival, Gal Paladins, and Monster Queers of Castle Gayskull. For even more inspiration, it features The Starcross Galaxy campaign setting along with five more settings from these contributing authors:
 Lesbeans Coffehouse by Dominique Dickey
 Neon City 2099 by Jamila Nedjadi
 The Three Orders of Ardor by Whitney Delaglio
 Les Violettes Dangereuses by Jonaya Kemper
 Yuisa Revolution by Alexis Sara
We also provide ample guidance on how to create your own tales of fighting with swords and falling in love, along with a world building worksheet, variant rules, and a set of starting scenario seeds to play with. Because the game focuses on feelings and relationships, it’s a lens you can use to play in a variety of genres. If you like slashfic of characters with swords, you’ll love this game.
Thirsty Sword Lesbians is explicitly designed to tell melodramatic and queer stories; tales fraught with relationship triangles, mystery, intrigue, relationship anarchy, celebration, and revolution. It includes rules to highlight different identities, emotional connections, and setting elements.
This game is not for fascists, TERFs, or other bigots. The team behind Thirsty Sword Lesbians supports racial liberation, intersectional feminism, and queer liberation. We love and respect transgender people, nonbinary people, intersex people, and women. This game is a joyous celebration of lives and identities otherwise marginalized. If you don’t agree, fix your heart before sharing a table with other people.
What if... not Thirsty? The game fundamentally assumes that the characters crave connection, but that connection doesn’t need to be sexual or romantic. We offer you options for changing how the game addresses connection in our variant rules section.
What if... not Swords? It’s simple enough to swap out a different hand-to-hand combat option. Your campaign or your character can use a labrys, the double-bladed axe that became a lesbian icon in the late 20th century. You can use different styles of unarmed combat or even grapple using telepathic self-projections. It’s also possible to replace the swords with mecha, starships, or guns, but it requires some thought and the book will help you think about how to ensure that it stays intimate and relationship-focused. The conflict doesn’t have to be physically violent, either; you can use any kind of conflict that’s adrenaline-inducing and close-quarters.
What if... not Lesbians? We’ll let you in on a secret: you don’t have to play a lesbian. The game plays with themes that are common for all sorts of people who are marginalized on the basis of gender and sexuality, as well as feelings that go beyond the queer experience. If you want to play thirsty sword cishets, we’re not going to stop you—just don’t be surprised if the game turns them queer.
What if... I’m not good at flirting or zingers? You don’t have to be witty or good at flirting in real life to play a character with those skills, and not every character in Thirsty Sword Lesbians is good with words. Shy and awkward sword lesbians find love, too. You’ll find them well-represented in this game.
Ready? Let’s Go!
Click for a PDF of this graph!
Wondering what’s involved in all those delicious bullet-points on that reward tier you’ve been flirting with? Here are your answers (scroll further down to find out about the many stretch goals already unlocked—look for the big glass)!



Angsty disaster lesbians, here and now! You can find details about the production timeline in the project's FAQ.
After the campaign is over (possibly a few months down the road) we'll launch a BackerKit for this campaign and invite the backers to set up your rewards.
BackerKit is a pledge manager: a separate website that gives you (and us!) greater control over what happens after the campaign than a simple survey would.
Based on our average shipping scenario in the USA, we're charging a flat $10 fee (media mail + handling costs) for book shipments to USA addresses.
BIG NEWS as of October 19th! Thanks to a big show of support from our friends at the UK-based Mongoose Publishing, we are now able to offer shipping outside the USA for this Kickstarter. Right now we have the Smitten (all flavors) and Nice tiers set up to offer shipping for $15 to destinations in Australia, Canada, the European Union, Japan, New Zealand, the Philippines, and the United Kingdom. We would be happy to add your location as well! 
Please contact us at feedback@evilhat.com if it looks like your destination is not yet covered, and we'll add it as an option as soon as we confirm the shipping rate for that country/region.
If you end up ordering multiple books for international shipment, we will bill an additional $5 per additional item in BackerKit well after the campaign is done.
April Kit Walsh (she/her or ze/zir) writes queer games about feelings, vulnerability, and caring for one another. She used to be a swordfighting ballerina, but claims those days are behind her; she has absolutely no idea who that masked heroine with the sword and the tutu might be. You can find April's games at GaySpaceship.com and on Twitter at @GaySpaceshipGms. When not writing RPGs, April is a civil liberties attorney working to protect the rights of activists, journalists, and everyone else impacted by technologies of control or of empowerment.
Avery Alder (she/her) is a queer designer hailing from Sinixt territory. She's the designer of Monsterhearts, The Quiet Year, Dream Askew, Ribbon Drive, and a host of smaller, scrappier projects. In her design and play, she gravitates toward the moody, the personal, and the transformative.
Whitney Marie Delaglio (she/her) is a game designer, artist, and creator of the brand Little Wish Productions. Her aquatic roleplaying game, Prism, focuses on sensuality, relationships, and conflict resolution. As a support class in the gaming community, she is an advocator of providing a safe space for intimacy, emotional vulnerability, and non-toxic bro culture.
Alexis Sara (she/her) is a multiple award winning comics writer and a massive lover of Tabletop RPGs. She works in every form of media she can telling stories of her fellow sapphics, trans folks and more overcoming great odds and falling in love. You can find Alexis's lesbian Latinx works over at @transcomics on twitter.
Dominique Dickey (they/them) is a writer, editor, cultural consultant, and all-around RPG hooligan. They love tea, naps, and dogs, and are inordinately proud to be a third generation Angeleno. More of their fiction and game design work can be found at dominiquedickey.com. They tweet as @DomSDickey.
Jonaya Kemper (she/they) is an activist, educator, and designer with a passion for transformational games. A deep fan of reimagining history, they hope that other will have as much fun imagining themselves in a floating Steamfunk fantasy as she did. Her game writing can be found in #Feminism, Honey and Hot Wax: an Anthology of Erotic Games, Visigoths vs. Mall Goths, The Ultimate Micro RPG Book, North Sea Legends, Kids on Bikes, and 7th Sea: Lands of Gold and Fire among her work in international larp and games academia. She has two cats who silently judge her, a plant obsessed spouse, and new feder to practice her beginning swordskills. 
Jamila R. Nedjadi (they/them) is the creative force behind Sword Queen Games and they believe in the power and magic of creative play. Their game BALIKBAYAN: Returning Home was nominated for the IGDN Indie Groundbreaker Award for best setting. Jammi is also a co-host of The Gauntlet podcast, a community podcast that focuses on play and indie TTRPGs. Jammi's sword is drawn from their revolutionary heart and showers the battle arena with purple roses! 
Lucian Kahn (he/him) is an award-winning game designer and gay-coded villain. His games include Visigoths vs Mall Goths (nominee for Best Writing, ENnie Awards 2020), Dead Friend: A Game of Necromancy (nominee for Most Innovative, IGDN Indie Groundbreaker Awards 2019) and If I Were a Lich, Man (winner for Most Innovative, IGDN 2020). Lucian co-edited Honey & Hot Wax: An Anthology of Erotic Art Games (with Sharang Biswas, published by Pelgrane Press, funded by grants from The Effing Foundation for Sex Positivity), which contains his surrealist game In the Clefts of the Rock. Follow him on twitter at @oh_theogony.
Allie Bustion is an award-winning freelance narrative designer and writer working on independent projects of their own, like HEIST and Misbehavin’, as well as titles for Paizo, Wizards of the Coast, and Guildhall Studios. They have a deep love of storytelling, fiction, pro wrestling, Final Fantasy XIV, and popular media analysis. Sometimes, those even come together. Like now.
Pam Punzalan, aka Pammu, is a queer designer, editor, sensitivity consultant and #RPGSEA community point person based in Manila. She's been published under Shadow Operations for Spire, and is involved in multiple projects big and small. Her biggest personal release isSundo: We, Once Mortal, a PbtA game about psychopomps rebelling against a world that has lied to them about the truth of their nature. Some of the things in development that she can talk about are a Dagger Isles supplement for Blades in the Dark, world building for The Islands of Sina Una, and game design for Mnemonic: Weaver's Almanac.
Libby Horacek is a game designer and software developer in West Virginia. Besides games, she loves drawing and roller skating. Her latest game is Derby Drama, inspired by her time skating with the Ohio Valley Roller Girls.
Mariam Ahmad (they/them) is a queer game designer, podcaster and streamer whose current project is writing Sarzameen, a South Asian fantasy setting. They are the GM of The Musafirs podcast, cast member of Prism Pals, and recently launched a BIMPoC community channel, Huetopia. They also love talking about food, decolonization and cats. 
Ash Cheshire (fae/fem) is a queer trans game designer and artist living in the bay area of northern California. Faer games can be found at ashcangames.itch.io or you can support faer ongoing work and receive exclusive access to experimental & pre-published games by joining the Cheshire Crew at patreon.com/ashcheshire  
Ash Kreider is a queer trans game designer, publisher, and sometimes-blogger living in the wilds of Canada with a child, a spouse, two slightly broken cats, and a snake. In addition to publishing their own games, they have also freelanced for companies like Pelgrane Press, Wizards of the Coast, and Onyx Path. Ash is also the author of Go Make Me a Sandwich, a once-popular feminist gaming blog, and do a lot of work to hold and create space for marginalized people in games.
Known mostly as a GM, Bryanna Hitchcock occasionally dabbles in game design and writing, including contributions to the Tome of Mysteries and Threadbare RPG. She is also the author of Empire City Adventures, a Fate superheroes supplement. Besides playing games, Bryanna loves playing guitar, rocking out to music, and cooking. She lives in California with her wife and two adorable cats.
James Mendez Hodes is an ENnie Award-winning cultural consultant and game designer whom you might know from Thousand Arrows, Scion, or some articles complaining about orcs and racism. You can find him online at jamesmendezhodes.com and on Twitter @LulaVampiro. His favorite She-Ra and the Princesses of Power character is Scorpia.
Kira Magrann is a queer nonbinary tabletop roleplaying game designer and snake friend living in Columbus, Ohio. The creator of A Cozy Den (a cozy game of lesbisnakes in winter time) and Something Is Wrong Here (an uncanny emotional love letter to David Lynch's work), Kira also has a Patreon that details current game design thoughts. Kira also co-curates the biweekly More Seats at the Table which is a newsletter featuring game makers of marginalized genders. Follow @Kiranansi on twitter. Games at Serpent Cyborg Games.
Ajey is a game designer of the BOLT RPG Engine, a fast and tactical toolbox RPG! He writes about game design on the #TabletopChopShop hashtag, and he reviews games on the #AjeyReads hashtag! He’s also done writing for Wanderhome and is a lightning mage in his free time.
Amr Ammourazz (They/She) is an all around nerd, with interests in everything from game design to audio fiction to mathematics and computer engineering. You can hear more about her various exploits in making everything more queer and Egyptian over at @ammourazz on twitter, such as being Co-Designer of the Chimera RPG.
Jan Martin (they/them) is a Mi'kmaw Writer living in New Brunswick, Canada. Their work explores themes of Capitalism and Colonialism through an Indigenous lens. They most recently have contributed to Starfinder Society Season 3-11: Into the Veskarium, UNCONQUERED by Monkey's Paws Games, and contributed Golden Watch Club to The Short Games Digest: Volume 5 by San Jenaro Co-Op. They are currently working on writing game content and the Original Sound Track for Monster Care Squad by Sandy Pug Games. They run Scraps Burgers, a fictional AI operated fast food empire that's actually a publisher of games. Coming soon is their debut release "Employee of the Year", an Anthology featuring five incredible designers and one lifesaver of an artist. Find them on twitter @hellotenbear or https://www.tenbear.com/
Katherine Alejandra Cross is a translatina scholar of the virtual who yearns for the robot uprising. While working on her PhD at the University of Washington iSchool, she has written extensive social criticism of gaming and tech, published sci-fi short stories, and contributed to numerous tabletop RPGs, including Pathfinder and Eclipse Phase. She lives in Seattle with her partner and two cats.
Soup (they/them) is a nonbinary, Korean-American game designer who releases approximately one game every human century or so. They love writing, food, and writing about food. You can find their personal work at literalsoup.com, their hot-blooded mech rivalry game Pyrewaltz:Love is Coming Again in the Ultimate Micro-RPG Book, or their freelance work scattered throughout various Paizo products and kickstarters (like this one).
Misha Bushyager is a longtime gamer and designer working on making sure the next generation of geeks sees themselves represented. She's one of the founders of New Agenda Publishing and a founding curator for More Seats at the Table, a newsletter highlighting gender marginalized designers.
Banana Chan (she/they) is a writer and designer for tabletop games and larps. She is also the owner and co-founder of the publishing company, Game and a Curry. Some of her latest projects have been Jiangshi: Blood in the Banquet Hall, Scooby-Doo: Betrayal at Mystery Mansion and Warp's Edge. You can find her on Twitter at @bananachangames
Christie Fremon (she/her) designs small words and big worlds. She’s a neurodiverse, demiflux, demisexual, bisexual lesbian parent who designs tabletop roleplaying games and content experiences. She focuses her design on centering humanity — and ways of being different. She likes to learn and dream. And she can’t get enough of stories, fairy tales, carnivorous plants, spiders, fiber arts, and magic.
Maria Fanning (She/Her or Hir/Hirs) is a trans woman wrestling fan extraordinaire. She has written articles for Cannibal Halfling, Voices of Wrestling & Gnome Stew. Alongside this, she has designed games such as Tower Of Power, Hero Too and Get Your Game On. Maria’s favorite interests in writing are messy trans narratives and taking tropes apart.
Clio Yun-su Davis is a game designer and writer who has contributed to tabletop RPGs such as Kids on Bikes, Teens in Space, and Hearts of Wulin. Their interactive horror novel The Fog Knows Your Name was published by Choice of Games in 2019. In addition to writing interactive fiction and RPGs, Clio has designed LARPs such as Pass the Sugar, Please and the card game Battle of the Boybands.
Lauren (they/she) is a tabletop rpg editor and designer with a keen interest in queer narratives, romance, and weird fantasy. They are the co-designer of Girl Underground, a portal fantasy trpg about a curious young person's journey as they navigate a weird, whimsical world and its rules alongside their fantastical companions. All of her work can be found at thestraykiwi.com, including Final Girl: A Game of Love, a satirical, queer trpg based on the Bachelor/ette. You can also follow them on Twitter @thestraykiwi
Alex Roberts is an RPG designer whose work focuses on interpersonal complexity and mechanical elegance. Though best known for Star Crossed and For the Queen, she has contributed to piles of other games and anthologies, and hosted the acclaimed interview show Backstory. She'd love to hear from you at helloalexroberts.com.
Emily (she/her) is an independent role-playing game designer/publisher and conservationist living in western Massachusetts, USA. She wrote the Romance Trilogy and co-designed Bubblegumshoe for Evil Hat Productions.  Her other games and work are at blackgreengames.com and you can follow her on Twitter at @emilycare.
Vylar Kaftan is a science fiction writer, a champion flirt, and a thirsty sword pansexual (though as a sixth level bard she prefers her harp). She won a Nebula Award for her novella "The Weight of the Sunrise." If a queer psychic thriller sounds up your alley, check out her book Her Silhouette, Drawn in Water. She lives in the San Francisco Bay Area. Her favorite color is all of them. She's on Twitter @Vylar_Kaftan.
 Jess (they/them)! Helpful smol ninja that likes to solve problems. Grinning cat face with smiling eyes Co-Admin & Producer for @HuetopiaTV.
Kanesha C. Bryant (she/her) is an illustrator who enjoys worldbuilding and creating unknowable horrors that are honestly just trying to get through the day. In her free time she talks about bunny necromancy in her Downtrodden lore project, and she recently wrote a choose-your-own-adventure horror game about a very normal bear. There are currently at least two large wild skinks living in her kitchen. It's fine. They're basically family now. You can find evidence that she exists at theveryworstthing.tumblr.com or @KaneshaCBryant.
Hannah (she/her) is a cartoonist and has worked as a colorist, cover artist and interior artist on titles such as GLOW, Samurai Jack, Jem and the Holograms, Captain Marvel, and Tomb Raider. She is also the creator of COSMOKNIGHTS, an original graphic novel series published by Top Shelf Comics. She enjoys life with her trusty dog Thistle and grumpy cat Noodle, and plays tabletop roleplaying games as often as she can. 
Trivia Fox (they/them/no pronoun) is a nonbinary creative currently living in Minneapolis, Minnesota. They've been gaming since the early 2000's as a teen where they began experimenting with gender identity and presentation. These experiences led them to their focus in the game industry, and they have worked as art director, illustrator, and in project management roles for the past decade. Recently, they were both art director and project manager for Burn Bryte by Roll20. They are overjoyed to be working with not only Evil Hat, but on Thirsty Sword Lesbians??? Heck Yes!!! Find them on twitter at @dark_deer_
Karen Twelves (she/her) is an editor and linguist who has worked on such games as Blades in the Dark, Fiasco, and Star Crossed. In 2018, she authored Improv for Gamers, a guide to using improvisational theater exercises to sharpen your roleplaying skills. Karen is also a team-building facilitator and leads workshops on collaboration and creativity through play. 
Jenn Martin (she/her) is a maker and wordsmith. She lives outside Chicago, IL and works as Production Manager for Bully Pulpit Games and LARP Coordinator for Big Bad Con. If you've played Fiasco in Roll20, you've seen her work! Jenn tweets at @tenpenjenn and you can find her work at the.kinematic.cafe/tenpenjenn
Sadie (she/her) is a Canada-based writer, artist, and game designer. She began her tabletop career at 5 years olds, when her mother's university friends invited her to join their game. She uses The Beast playbook in real life.
Shaun (he/him) lives in rural northern California with his family and a small menagerie of dogs, fish, and birds. He is also in his junior year as a Media Arts student at Chico State University. When he's not working on a project, he can usually be found running RPGs on Twitch or at Big Bad Con.
Sean (he/him) is the Evil Hat director of projects, steward of Big Bad Con, and host of twitch.tv/actualplay. He recently co-authored the game AGON with John Harper. Sean also played in one of the first Thirsty Sword Lesbian playtests. Chosen 4EVAR!
Fred Hicks (he/him) is a dad, a gamer, and a game publisher. He runs Evil Hat Productions and has done freelance art direction and layout work for the occasional other game publisher. He helped create Fate, and designed the game Don’t Rest Your Head.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have a great team on this project. Evil Hat is an experienced RPG publisher. We've run over a dozen successful Kickstarter campaigns and we've printed many roleplaying games in a variety of physical formats over the past few years.

This puts us in a fine position to take on the risks and challenges that will arise. Experience tells us that things don’t always go as planned.

Here's what we can anticipate as potential problems.

The Text: While Thirsty Sword Lesbians is largely done aside from the art and other polishing touches, it's possible backers will identify some glaring issue that we need to address before we take this fully to publication. That can add time, for sure. Luckily we have several talented writers available if we need a fix, as well as layout and editing people on standby, so any necessary changes should proceed quickly.

Printing: We have a strong, established relationship with our printers. We’ve got them on tap to print the books in whatever quantity we end up needing. But printers can run into problems all the same: supply shortages, unexpected delays due to company holidays or industry events, shipping problems, printing errors, and so on. We’ve got the experience to stay atop those potential problems and the flexibility to pivot and address them promptly. In the event of defective product, we will send a replacement at no cost to you. We print our books in the USA, so there's less of a chance the economic policies of the current administration will suddenly cause the cost of the book to skyrocket or otherwise introduce problems getting the books from the printer to us.

Shipping: Packages get lost. We'll send replacements. Shipping can take longer than expected. We won't put the book on sale until all backer copies are shipped out. Shipping costs can end up higher than expected. We'll absorb the overage.

Finances: While Evil Hat has seen some leaner months more recently, we've made the necessary cuts to our expenses to make sure we can sustain the company throughout 2020 and 2021. Also, we've already invested time and money to get Thirsty Sword Lesbians to this point with no pending expenses on the project outside of the ones we're funding here. Our bank account continues to look plenty healthy. If an unexpected cost arises, we've got the cushion to take the hit.

We often run a couple Kickstarters per year. This is a carefully planned process based on our 14+ successful Kickstarters in the past. Because Kickstarter fulfillment takes time, these campaigns can overlap. When it happens, that's something we plan for extensively. We make space for each Kickstarter, fulfillment, and distribution release in our schedule, and we work to ensure that resources are available to take each of our projects across the finish line.

If there's any risk or challenge YOU can think of that we haven't mentioned here, please write in and ask. We love to answer questions, and we do our best to provide an unparalleled customer service experience whenever possible. We intend to impress you.

campaign.story:
When things are at their worst, the best among us rises to the fore. When disaster strikes or menace looms, they don’t run from the danger, they run toward it. Whether they claim supernatural abilities or just plain courage, there's a single word that describes such people:
In a world that could use a few heroes now more than ever, you can now join their ranks—using the flexible TTRPG mechanics of the Cypher System.
Imagine, for a moment, that you find yourself imbued with powers well beyond those of mere mortals. With great might, you leap into dark and daunting dangers. You stand before the forces of injustice with confidence. You slip the grasp of gravity and soar. You Claim the Sky itself.
But what about on the other end of the scale, where we’re all a bit more earth-bound? We can still be heroes. Saving lives amid natural disasters, man-made cataclysms, pandemics, or crises of any sort, we can take on the role of First Responders.
These two new Cypher System sourcebooks focus on heroes of all kinds!
Claim the Sky continues the series of genre-focused books that includes The Stars Are Fire (science-fiction), Stay Alive! (horror), We Are All Mad Here (fairy tales), and Godforsaken (fantasy). Each of those titles dives deep, exploring different aspects and variations of its genre and offering new rules, character creation ideas, equipment, creatures, cyphers, and other elements for making the most of the topic.
In this case, of course, the topic is superheroes. Whether your love is comic book superheroes or the blockbuster films of recent years, Claim the Sky will give you step-by-step guidelines for recreating all your favorite characters, building your own heroes from scratch, and sending them out into fun, fast-paced RPG adventures and campaigns.
But there’s more. Like the books that came before it, Claim the Sky presents a fully realized, ready-to-use superhero setting: Boundless. In the world of Boundless, your player characters can join the ranks of well-established heroes and face titanic foes: invading alien creatures, horrors from other dimensions, supervillains using their powers for selfish or destructive ends. This setting is like our own world, but superpowers have existed for generations, and the world has adapted accordingly (in sometimes surprising ways!). If you’re looking for a setting with the feel of movies or comics, Boundless will take you there!
First Responders looks at heroism from a different angle. This is a world where the heroes' powers aren't supernatural: our world, where courage, wits, experience, and grit are the tools by which our heroes overcome crises and disaster. Around the globe, the PCs respond to earthquakes and hurricanes, floods and fires, war zones and industrial disasters, plane crashes and pandemics. They're part of an international organization with a mission to save lives and to not just respond to crises, but to end them.
In First Responders, you create a campaign with a broad roster of heroes. In one session you might need a paramedic, a trained rescue worker, and a firefighting specialist, while the next mission requires the paramedic, a field researcher, and a pilot, and the one after that you need a rescue worker, a field researcher, and a technician. The players maintain multiple characters, but the unique system advances them all, regardless of which are involved in a given adventure, so that any can be called upon as the campaign progresses and the threats become ever more dangerous.
First Responders also provides exciting rules for mega-challenges, making events like a forest fire or an earthquake into a fully-realized narrative filled with challenges as dynamic and exciting as any battle against monsters or crawl through a dungeon. These large-scale challenge rules will be easily useable in any Cypher System game, so you can incorporate them into your Numenera campaign, or adventures based on Claim the Sky, The Stars Are Fire, or any other Cypher System setting.
Our world needs heroes. Cypher System fans love new books. We've already unlocked The Origin, a new hardcover setting book. And we're looking forward to reaching the Cypher System Bestiary later in this campaign! What else might we unlock before that title—or beyond it? We have lots of great ideas, and look forward to lots of cool stretch goals!
The critically acclaimed, award-winning Cypher System is fast-paced, narrative-focused, flexible, and uniquely easy on the GM. Baked-in mechanics like Effort and player intrusions easily support heroic styles of play—PCs can really push themselves to do amazing things. The Cypher System’s Power Shift mechanic and Power Boost cyphers perfectly portray the way superpowers work. They make it easy to show how a super-strong hero can break down a door without thinking twice or how another hero might briefly try something unique with their powers to get a very specific effect. Both of these mechanics—and more—will be even further developed in Claim the Sky.
Creating a great Cypher System character is as easy as coming up with a great concept. You build the character you imagine through a quick, fun process that results in a character with depth, nuance, and flexibility.
Cypher System characters are built with a three-part sentence. You might be a Rugged Warrior who Stands Like a Bastion. A Guarded Adept who Keeps a Magic Ally. Perhaps a Graceful Explorer who Moves Like the Wind. Or a Charming Speaker who Bears a Halo of Fire. Each part of your sentence says something about your character—but also provides some of your abilities, skills, and stats. They even offer guidance on your connections to other characters in your party, creating bonds that can be a foundation for an ongoing campaign, or facilitate great roleplaying in one-shot adventures.
Cyphers give characters single-use abilities frequently gained and spent, adding variety to the character’s capabilities and providing exciting new approaches and options. Depending on what’s appropriate for the campaign, cyphers can be subtle, representing blessings, unusual turns of luck or capricious powers, or manifest, in the form of bits of unusual technology, charms, or minor magic items.
Character arcs encourage and reward players for pursuing their characters’ own motivations, in addition to the overall story of the campaign. Just as the heroes of movies, comics, and TV shows grow through their own subplots, Cypher System players may choose arcs to pursue, tying their characters’ personalities more closely to the overall story and engaging the players even deeper into their characters and the campaign.
No problem! Every backer level includes a copy of the complete Cypher System Rulebook in PDF. This 448-page book is a $22 value in PDF, but it's free with every reward and delivered early, mere weeks after the campaign closes. (Already have the CSR? You can gift your free PDF to a friend!)
Want to Check It Out Now?
Download the free Cypher System Rules Primer, and have a look at the system's amazing mechanics right now!
Claim the Sky is a 224-page hardcover (upgraded to include a poster map!) that delves deeply into all aspects of the superhero genre. With a similar look and form, it's a beautiful companion to the recent Cypher System supplements The Stars Are Fire, Godforsaken, Stay Alive!, and We Are All Mad Here. Beautifully illustrated, it explores the many facets and subgenres of superhero comics, movies, and fiction, with rules and options for all of them. It includes the Boundless campaign setting, along with creatures, cyphers, artifacts, equipment, and more.
First Responders is a 128-page hardcover (strike that: we've upgraded the page count through stretch goals!) that presents rules, options, gear, and more for heroes inspired by the real world to take on massive challenges and dangers.
The Origin is a 128-page hardcover (strike that: we've upgraded the page count through stretch goals!) setting book. This is a world where superheroes are not a fact of life. Player characters must come to grips with the fact that they can do things normal humans cannot, and then decide what to do with these abilities while facing clandestine government branches, terrorist organizations, and even more mysterious groups that want to study, recruit, or destroy them.
Every backer level includes a copy of the complete Cypher System Rulebook in PDF. This 448-page book is a $22 value in PDF, but it's free with every reward and delivered early, mere weeks after the campaign closes. If you already have the CSR, we'll make it easy to gift your free PDF to a friend.
Are You a First Responder? If you're a firefighter, EMT or paramedic, emergency worker, or other front-line hero, the Real-World Heroes backer level gives you First Responders and the Cypher System Rulebook at a deep discount just for you.
Looking to Get into the Cypher System? You'll get the Cypher System Rulebook in PDF at any reward level. Prefer it in glorious hardcover? The Brand New Hero level gives you every title funded by this campaign, plus the CSR in print (a $70 value). Or check out Any Character, Any Campaign, which includes four additional genre books at an astounding discount! If you're looking to spend a little less, you can instead choose the CSR as an add-on.
Want to Playtest—or Just See It Early? Materials for the titles funded by this campaign generally go to playtesters about four months before those titles become products and go out as backer rewards (that's a generalization, though—not a specific commitment). If you'd like to be part of the action, or just have early access to the materials to check them out, or to roll the mechanics into your existing Cypher System campaign, back at any level from The Danger Room up. Backers at these levels may choose to be part of the playtest, or simply to receive the playtest material without providing feedback. It's up to you!
Love an Incredible Deal? To get your hands on a whole stack of awesome Cypher System products, you can't do better than the Any Character, Any Campaign or THOOOM! reward levels. The savings are so spectacular they're a bargain even if you already own some of the titles. All the levels from The Danger Room and up also get you the Cypher System playmat for free, and early access and playtesting!
Are You a Retailer? The Secret Base level is a flexible way for you to decide how many of each title is right for your store, and to avoid tying up lots of cash between now and release. Your pledge gets you three copies each of Claim the Sky and First Responders. You may, at a later time, increase the quantity of these titles, and add additional titles funded by stretch goals. You’ll pay for those additional titles, at a retail-friendly discount, at that time. It is likely (but not guaranteed) that you will get them ahead of street date, and you are welcome to begin selling them immediately. For this retail backer level only, MCG covers domestic US shipping—but you must still complete BackerKit and follow our fulfillment process (see Shipping, below).

REWARD REDEMPTION AND FULFILLMENT Because we will ship rewards at several times over the course of many months, our fulfillment process may be different than other campaigns you’ve backed.
A few weeks after this campaign ends, we will invite you to BackerKit, our pledge management platform. This allows you to confirm your pledge and add on anything you might have missed. Later, when a reward is ready to fulfill, you'll use the MCG Shop to manage the process. This puts you, the backer, in charge of redeeming rewards at your convenience, and ensures we always have your up-to-date address at the time we ship a reward. YOU MUST COMPLETE THIS STEP TO RECEIVE YOUR REWARD.
Here’s a brief look at how it works:
1.  When a reward is ready, we’ll notify you by email.
2.  You log on to the MCG Shop.
3.  You go to your Coupons page and click on the coupon for the reward, and it is automatically added to your cart. If you have multiple rewards, or want to make purchases, you can add them all to your cart before checking out.
4. Check out! You give us your address and pay for shipping (for physical rewards) at that time.
UPDATING YOUR ADDRESS OR GIFTING YOUR REWARD If you move, you won’t need to tell us, since you’ll simply enter your new address the next time you redeem a reward. If this is a gift and you want to ship it directly to the recipient, just enter their shipping address when you check out. If it's not convenient to receive a reward at the time of fulfillment, or to ship multiple rewards together to save on shipping costs, you may delay redemption of a reward for up to one year after the product’s release date. 
SHIPPING All backers pay for shipping when they redeem their rewards. We offer a variety of domestic and international shipping methods from which you can choose. As of this writing, basic domestic shipping is $7 per shipment, but we do not control future postal rates, so that cost is subject to change. International shipping is based on postal and shipping rates at the time of the order, and varies by destination and shipment weight.
INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING International shipping is expensive. We don’t have any control over that, and we can’t accurately predict what shipping rates will be at the time of fulfillment. We must comply with international law and cannot mark your reward as a gift or as a zero-value item. Here are details that apply to your region:
 The Americas: Your rewards will be filled by our shipping center in the United States. You will be responsible for import duties, taxes, and brokerage fees (if applicable). Canadian backers please note that our books are printed in Canada, and thus are not subject to import duties; however, items not printed in Canada, such as decks of cards, are subject to import duties.
 The EU and UK: Your rewards will be filled by our shipping center in the UK. UK and EU backers will not pay import duties and taxes.
 Australia, New Zealand, the South Pacific, and Asia: Your rewards will be filled by our shipping center in Australia. Backers in Australia will not pay import duties and taxes; other backers will be responsible for import duties, taxes, and brokerage fees (if applicable).
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Monte Cook Games has run sixteen previous Kickstarter campaigns. All of our previous campaigns have been successful and jam-packed with rewards. Most of those campaigns are completely fulfilled, and we have a strong record for fulfilling rewards on time—we’ve delivered well over a million rewards to date. These include such varied items as corebooks for Numenera, The Strange, and the Cypher System, leather-bound deluxe books, boxed sets, scores of hardcover supplements, signed bookplates, playtest access, special-access seminars, meetings and dinners with the creative team, online and in-person games, and so much more. Thus, while there are always challenges that can arise, we've probably already faced them.

We are extremely proud of our track record. There have been bumps on the road, but what are roads without bumps? We're confident that the project will meet all its promises.

Please take a moment and complete the BackerKit survey. It gives you loads of good information about our processes and it gives us vital fulfillment information.

Greetings backers!
We hope you are healthy and well.
This is a mini-update to let you know that we've started opening BackerKit for Heroes of the Cypher System . . . huzzah!
The first step in opening BackerKit is to send surveys to 5% of backers from each pledge level (the 5% of backers to receive surveys is selected at random). BackerKit calls this step the Smoke Test. Once the surveys are sent, BackerKit collates data on the response rate, the proportion of support inquiries received, and the add-on purchase rate to let us know if the survey and pledge questions are working appropriately. Once we're sure all is well, surveys will be sent to all remaining backers. We expect this to happen no later than Tuesday, January 12th.

updates.update_userinfo: Thank You So Much for a Great Campaign! Plus, What Comes Next
updates.update_content:
Greetings, heroes—
Thank you so much for your support of Heroes of the Cypher System. We are thrilled to be making these books, along with the other great products that will make your Cypher System games (and ours!) better, faster, and more fun. We’re looking forward to sending you these rewards over the months to come, and we think you’ll be really happy with the results!

Greetings, hero!
This campaign ends in less than an hour, and we’re closing in on unlocking the XP Deck. It’s a real nail-biter. Will we make it? We have, in the past, unlocked goals literally in the final minutes of a campaign. It will take a stretch to make this one happen (that’s why they call them stretch goals!), but we’ve succeeded in similar stretches in the past!
Some Critical Things to Take Care Of

Greetings, heroes—
We’ve hit another stretch goal, and upgraded The Origin. We’re adding more pages, more art, more crunchy bits, and most importantly, more fantastic ideas and inspiration. Every backer who has The Origin among their rewards just got more of it, for free!

updates.update_userinfo: Some Good News for EU Backers
updates.update_content:
Greetings, heroes—
If you’re in the EU, we have some good news that we’re making official today. (I say “making official, because this has been in the works for months—since well before the Kickstarter launched—but we didn’t want to make an announcement until all the details were completely finalized.)
We ship our products, including Kickstarter rewards, to EU customers from our fulfillment site in the UK. With Brexit on the way, there’s been some uncertainty about how that will be handled. We may at some point open an EU shipping site, but for now we’ve been able to ensure that you will not pay any duties or import fees on your rewards that ship from the UK.

Click and help this project get extra exposure.
To whet your appetite we are giving this full adventure for FREE, where your players can test their mettle against Baastherox, the Mightiest.
             Filled with all you need to take your players in a 4-session adventure through the dangerous wastes in Drakha, in search of a relic of immense power that could very well earn you the right to return home, if you survive the ordeal and deliver it to Aureus Fulgen, the Azhurma who personally chose you to retrieve it.
Book Great Wyrms of Drakha
Kuxcoatl, painted by Angel Giraldez
These dragons have the same dimensions as their resin siblings, however we had to make adjustments so a few parts fit the requirements of the miniatures’ molding and manufacturing in plastic. We took great care in adapting them to this new format, so the final result is as amazing as their resin counterparts, and the best part is we can make a LOT of them way faster!
So, if you did not get a dragon during the past Kickstarter campaign with limited print runs, or if you wanted to get more but weren’t able to at the time, this is the best chance to get them. Plus, these dragon miniatures will make the final encounters of each adventure in the Great Wyrms of Drakha book truly epic.
Of course, none of this would be possible without the support of our previous backers from Dragons of the Red Moon and we are committed to keep working hard to deliver all 5 waves. If you are a backer from Dragons of the Red Moon, you will still get your resin cast miniatures, but now you will also get the PDF book of Great Wyrms of Drakha for free.
 We are launching this campaign with 3 dragons already available in plastic version.
* Elyse model (32mm) for scale reference only. Not included. Each dragon is approximately 200mm tall.
Our backers will always get the best deal with bundles, experience and perks.
           As each stretch goal is unlocked, you will receive more content in the book detailing the world of the Red Moon with more key locations and an extended menagerie of creatures to keep their players on their toes. 
  As Drakhan dragons are wont to do, this project can grow in size and content with every milestone reached, until it becomes a full-fledged primer detailing Drakha’s visible face, full of incredible artwork by top talent, new beasts, monsters, regions and magic items for your PCs to discover, fight and conquer.
           The Azhurmas have already sensed your hunger for power and they all want to oblige you in your defiance to their rule.
           After all, life would be boring without a worthy challenge. 
 Here’s what some of our past backers are saying about the Great Wyrms models in previous campaigns where the STL 3D printing files or resin miniatures for Dragons of the Red Moon were available.
Resin copy of Sivax Magnifex from Dragons of the Red Moon. Painted by Draco Studios ambassador: @michellelacourt
Here you can see further examples of what our fantastic backers are doing with the resin miniatures or 3D models they’ve already printed! Look at those paint jobs!
Click to see more!

His Radiant Majesty Aureus, ruler of the Fulgen brood, the most beautiful and majestic of all dragon kind. Beloved, admired, envied and hated in equal measure, Aureus Fulgen’s Most High Vision took form in The Golden City, the beacon of civilization in Drakha and the seat of his power. But some believe his rule is flawed and the time for change has come.

The adventurers, recently deputised as members of the Steelclaws, are summoned to a private meeting with Aureus Fulgen and given a mission by His Radiant Majesty himself. They are to follow the clues left by a long-dead sage and retrieve a relic of great power from a place in the middle of the Drakhan desert. Their harrowing and brutal journey will take them right to the heart of the nightmarish territory ruled by none other than Baastherox The Broodless, the Warrior Philosopher… The Mightiest.

Kuxcoatl’s thirst for knowledge raised him above all others and transformed him into the grandest of them all. Still, inside the teeming, cryptic jungle known as The Arcanum Wilds, something has been stirring and it brings uninvited change with it. Is someone following Kuxcoatl’s example and furthering their knowledge to rule over any and all transformations? What lies at the end of the deep, puzzled-riddled maze surrounding the “Whisper of Change,” an object rumoured to unlock the most arcane secrets?
Forged in the fires of a volcano and her own inventiveness, Derhilya raised herself above the weak, malformed shape she was born with and turned herself into The Forge Queen. Toiling at the Flawless Forge, she leaves her brood to tinker and create, amassing objects of mind-defying craftsmanship and intricate beauty. One of these, lying somewhere in the Forge Queen’s lair, is said to have been designed as the great equalizer against a direct threat to the Scalebreakers… and a map drawn in blood by one of them, shows the way to its whereabouts.

The adventurers have come into possession of a set of instructions to craft a very  powerful magic item: “The Cloak of the Myriad Shifting Skins,” but a key component lies in the Eveflux quicksilver pools somewhere in the poisonous canals running deep inside Paradis’ tunnels, the domain of the splendid Sivax Magnifex. Unbeknownst to them, locked in the crystalline tunnels lies a “dormant” golem said to have an unparalleled beauty and rumored to lend the power to breach any wall to whomever controls it. Yet, the galleries leading to the vaults are filled with madness and terror… a combination Sivax finds most pleasing.
The time has come for Rawraxxa to prove to herself she still is the apex huntress, and nothing is safe from her hunger and the Brood Levy. A nomadic group of escaped Valernians has wandered into the low mountains bordering the Shrillling Sands, believing they would find refuge on the caves and long-vacant wurm tunnels… but now find themselves caught in a cataclysmic battle for survival between a small, dying brood and the unstoppable Rawraxxa who has come to them with her customary demand:“prove you’re fit to join my brood; else.. become prey.”
Valernians are convinced dragons fear nothing... Nixis knows better. In truth, all other dragons fear Her, for she has transcended what her former kind conceive as what’s farthest from them: death itself. Now, the whispers in the wind are carrying tales of a group of “slayers of dragons.” The adventurers, Valernian escapees and survivalists, have earned a reputation as mighty combatants and as “scourge of dragonkind” for themselves... and anything that can kill a dragon, is something Nixis will find some use for to further her own ends…  whether they want to join her or not.
In Great Wyrms of Drakha, you’ll find:
 Seven high-level, 4-session adventures; each one dedicated to your players actually fighting one of the Azhurmas as their final challenge
 Maps for all relevant locations used in the adventures and key regions in Drakha
 Bestiary! Statblocks and background for every single creature mentioned in the adventures, with all the detail you need to make them come alive and challenge your players
 Items of Might, Wisdom and Horror. New magic items and relics found only in Drakha, plus technology exclusive to the Valernians captive in the Red Moon.
 Amazing art showcasing Drakhan uniqueness, with its breathtaking landscapes and awe-inspiring creatures.
Extensive, enticing, but never excessive!
  We love doing what we do. But even more than that, sharing our work with our passionate backers who are enthusiastic about what we create, is the wind beneath Draco Studios' wings.  We’d be honored if you joined us to make it a reality. However, we are well aware the times are trying and we don’t want you to break the bank.
    Thus, we’ve created a series of very reasonable pledge tiers and several add-on options, plus stretch goals to enhance the contents in the book, to allow you to tailor your choices to fit your immediate needs.  
    If you decide you can afford an extra expense at a later time, you’ll be able to do so via the Pledge Manager, and once the campaign ends, you will have the chance to make late pledges via Backerkit for a limited (yet reasonable) time.
Challenge completed! But you can keep sharing this Facebook post to spread the word even more!
Challenge completed! But feel free to keep retweeting to increase exposure even more!
Click to download the free STL file of Baastherox Bust.

We take great care and are pretty serious with the battlemaps created for you to enjoy and use with your adventures, as battlemaps embellish every gaming table around the world, and everybody loves a great looking gaming table.
       Everyone knows one of the best things about dragons is their lairs.
       As part of our Great Wyrms of Drakha Kickstarter campaign, we are releasing all the lair battlemaps as printable 3D STL files as an add-on for $10 USD. The 2D battlemaps are already included in the book, but for those who have access to 3D printers, why not go 3D for a truly epic final battle with the scenery befitting such a momentous occasion?
       We have partnered with Townsmith to have the modular  lairs available in Townbuilder Unlimited. You will be able to upgrade your tier in Backerkit for $5 extra.
        As we progress on our Community Goals throughout the campaign, the structures for the rest of 3D battlemaps will be included in the bundle, and these will not be merely the base-level grid. The Titan’s skull from Baastherox’s lair is already included in this initial 3D-printable bundle. By completing social challenges, the rest of the lairs will add yet another layer of greatness to your epic.
        Are you ready to experience the breathtaking Draconic architecture on their own gaming tables?
These STL files are for personal-use only, although a commercial license will be available afterwards. All lairs are OpenLOCK compatible.
For group pledges or if you just want to add extra copies for you, as a gift or to grant us additional support to our campaign, you can manage your pledge and modify the amount to add extra copies of any product, be it the printed book or miniature(s) of your choice. You can expect saving on shipping, but it will be mandatory for you to cover shipping on the pledge manager.


Retailers
We are always happy & willing to offer a good deal to all brick-and-mortar retailers / board-game cafés, especially now with the trying times most locales are having given the new normality brought about by the pandemic. Thus, we are willing to provide as much support to the people and businesses doing their best to keep the hobbyists and players well catered for. So, we’re doing this in a couple of ways:
Excellent profit margins: 
Our retailer and corporate sales teams can provide you with a tailored plan to better tend to your business’ specific needs.

Thematic display exhibitors: 
With Great Wyrms of Drakha, Draco is launching its line of “Thematic Display Exhibitors,” designed to make our books and dragons to catch your customers’ eye and embellish your store’s display areas. Then, you don’t need to worry about the number of display units you might need, as we have already devised a system where the display’s size will depend on and easily accommodate the product you order from us.
        As retailers in Mexico City ourselves, the method we prefer is having a deposit ($5 tier) made during the Kickstarter, placing the full order in the pledge manager and pay for the games and shipping fees just before fulfillment begins.
        We want you to get your order to you as early as possible; that is: before the products are available with your usual distributors.
        Cartons come with multiple copies of each product. The discount will be calculated against MSRP of your total order.
        You are welcome to host pre-orders with your customers and let us know if you would be interested to offer local pickup for any backers in your area, making this the first step in what we would love to become a long and prosperous business relationship with your store.

A NOTE ON OUR STL AND COMMERCIAL LICENSING

       As part of our design and business principles and because several members of our team have always been strong proponents of 3D printing, this Kickstarter campaign also contains several options for backers to obtain our STL files* as add-ons to their main pledge, but these are for personal use only.
       However, if you run a 3D Printing shop or plan on commercializing any of our models—we get it, why wouldn’t you? They’re great!—you can apply for a commercial license directly with our LAIR division. We are honored and appreciate your willingness to make our products reach more people. We at Draco have made it priority to help your business grow, so drop us a line; let us hear from you so we answer your questions and offer you our dedicated customer support.
Our plastic products are commissioned to PANDA GM, a prestige manufacturer based in China. After production is completed, the miniatures will be sent from China to multiple fulfillment centers in different regions of the world (USA, Canada, Mexico, UK, Europe, China & Australia) to offer all of our backers fair shipping rates and custom-cleared parcels —Draco will always be an ardent proponent of friendly-shipping projects. We got your back!  
Once more, we will be working with Backerkit to manage your pledge orders and make sure we get everything right when sending out your rewards to you!

Shipping will be charged once the Kickstarter Campaign for this project ends. This way we can offer you the most competitive shipping rates possible as this allows to make more precise calculations depending on each region’s specific volume of sales.
Transparency is of paramount importance for us. We are not just creators, we are also avid backers too for other projects and as such, we understand your expectations and your doubts. 
It is your support what has brought us this far. And we aim for the highest quality. As a group, Draco Studios is parent company of Draco Forge, LAIR 3D, and partner of other great publishers such as Detestable Games or Gnomosapiens. We have made collaborations for other projects with amazing publishers such as River Horse, Jetpack7, Arcane Minis, Townsmith, and many people in the industry that we consider now part of the Draco family.
Our past projects have been a marvelous learning experience, and all of them are very important for us. We strive for perfection, and we consider to have delivered a ton of extra value for our backers for a fraction of the MSRP. 
Covid19 was a challenge for us in the past months too. However, we are finally in the last stretch for War for Chicken Island (arriving to fulfillment centers with a huge box and ton of miniatures), and for Eldritch Century RPG (we ended producing 2 books instead of 1 because of all the written content we developed, and delivered with amazing art. Production is about to start and digital fulfillment within this week with a Beta preview already available for backers). 
Dragons of the Red Moon (70% fulfilled) was the one impacted the most by Coronavirus, but we have always been clear about our plans with Great Wyrms of Drakha; Draco Forge (our resin cast workshop) is recovering speed for the missing waves, with production impacted by this year's events. The response from Dragons of the Red Moon was so positive, that we had to plan for 5 production waves instead of 1 (already fulfilled). Draco Forge has also already fulfilled our very first project for Eldritch Century resin miniatures.
Projects from LAIR 3D (subsidiary company of Draco Studios) have been fulfilled on time (stretch goals from Dragonbond: Battles of Valerna pending but those were promised at a later date).
It is important to note that we have different teams working on each project.
Here's what the timeline for this and our other projects' fulfillment look like:
You can count that we will be always here, in the comments, in direct messages or over e-mail to let you know the status of your rewards and we will not rest until all our promises are fulfilled.
Sivax Magnifex, painted by Angel Giraldez
Dragons… who doesn’t love or is fascinated by these colossal creatures?
Draco Studios is a team of people who love dragons, and many of the things we do is with other people who share this love for dragons.
Draco Studios has been developing the setting for over two years. It was GenCon 2018 when Draco Studios met Tom Babbey and we have been collaborating ever since to bring these fabulous dragons and their homeworld of Drakha to life for all to discover wonder and fear.
 Kickstarter voice video by Jonathan Luhmann.

Want to know more about what we do? Keep in touch through our social media! We are happy to hear from you.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The preview information here is subject to ongoing change as we receive feedback.

OBJECTIVE
With this campaign we want to bring our first corebook. Some components in this campaign, at our discretion, might not be obtainable elsewhere. We are working with talented partners to manage this project and campaign based in the universe from Draco Gaming Inc, Great Wyrms of Drakha.

POLICIES
This the fifth campaign for a physical product of Draco Studios. Just as always, we are committed to do everything right and connect with people from around the world who share the love for dragons, RPG, miniatures, and 3D printing.
We can refund you within 7 days of the campaign’s end, fees included. After that, we have a policy of no questions asked, though that’s minus Kickstarter and payment processing fees and other result-based marketing fees (-25%). This policy lasts until the time when we lock orders in our pledge manager, after that point no refunds are possible. If we realise a component cannot be delivered after many months of trying, we refund that completely at the best of our effort, including fees.

This will be a transparent campaign, if any issues occur, we will let you know through project updates – which will be regularly posted after the campaign is funded. At least once per month.
We are so committed to publishing our products with the best quality, that we will put money from our pockets if needed in case of any undesired events.

BackerKit is our preferred software to manage the pledges and to ensure a smooth process for our backers for selecting add-ons. Backers should answer their surveys before the indicated deadline to expect to receive their rewards at the promised time. Otherwise, their rewards will be sent on a second wave of deliveries or incur in extra shipping charges.

Manufacturing will be held with professional RPG books printers, selection of manufacturer may vary depending on scope. If your product arrives damaged after shipping or has any issues, we will send you a replacement for no extra cost. We might ask you to return the other copy and send proof of the issue with a picture (in case we need to file a claim with the postal service).

Any Kickstarter Exclusives are available by us only on active Kickstarter campaigns and special events such as gaming conventions. Availability of the pledge manager is not mandatory and we reserve the right to take that decision.

Please note that shipping fees for physical rewards will be collected after the campaign ends via a pledge manager. Reward tiers say "Ships anywhere in the world" to indicate that backers anywhere can support the project. It does not mean free shipping.

CHALLENGES
Even though we are trying to offer you a flawless campaign, we aren’t sure whether we will get enough backers to reach the funding goal. We have a large team that will work on fulfilling this project, and we would like to ask for your help to spread the word with a friend, a local store, or your social media.

RISKS
Third-party issues happening during shipping will be treated on a case-by-case basis. We will share with you every progress related to the project.
The most probable delays are:
Production delays
Shipping delays
Customs delays
We have added some buffer time to the project timeline scope; but as many Kickstarters, delays are still possible.

Get your samples! Grab the PDF of the Blackstorm Sorcerer and Gravity Domain (cleric)!
Free 17-page PDF sampler

 GET READY FOR ADVENTURE!
An infinite number of worlds await your discovery out in the vast chasm of the Blackstorm. Realms of unbelievable power, immeasurable wealth, and enigmatic secrets are waiting for you to visit and explore. Realms are continually created and lost in the turbulent Blackstorm. Meanwhile, the gods and goddesses of multiple realms wage war with an ancient group of beings determined to bring all that exists to heel. 
Customize your character with an array of fantastic magical devices called Aparatum. Upgrade your magic with an optional advanced magic system. Explore new realms and meet many intriguing races. Get to know something new with our advanced magic system as well as new playable classes and other great features. Face unimaginable perils in the Blackstorm and help save all the realms!
Players and game masters, this book is for you. Blackstorm Realms is all about YOUR worlds. And, it's about character customization options with our optional customization system called Aparatum. It is a playground without boundaries; you'll have fresh lore to invigorate your campaigns and provide new places, and a system of character customization to keep your games and characters from being the same and stale.
 Blackstorm Realms allows you to incorporate your own homebrew realms, well-known official realms, and third party realms into one seamless universe and provides you with the means to move back and forth between all of them. Are there suns and moons and stars in your realm? Then give your players an opportunity to discover what's on them, not just what's beyond the horizon, BUT also what is beyond the BEYOND!
In Blackstorm Realms, you are introduced to at least three new realms that exist in a galaxy known as The Celestial Tree. 
Dwarven Citadel
Let's not stop there, though. What else does Blackstorm Realms offer? You'll have new classes and archetypes, races, and spells and magic items at your fingertips. But let's go a bit further, shall we? You'll discover the existence of a hidden, galaxy-spanning enemy that works to dominate realm after realm and intimately tied to a mix of magic-and-material crafting called Aparatum. You'll discover secret societies, factions with intriguing motivations and goals, weapons that can slice through the fabric of reality, ancient celestial leviathans that move through the Blackstorm at breathtaking speed, jaw-dropping wonders between realms to explore, and so much more.
Here's the best part, too: whatever campaign and/or world you are currently running can continue. Blackstorm Realms is simply opening the door and providing the rules and mechanics for creating a larger, shared universe and the means to explore it all.

In short:
1. At least three new realms/worlds for you to explore.
2. New customization options for your characters called Aparatum. Think of them as mechanisms that can enhance your character's body and mind ...but there are risks that balance out the gifted power.
3. Complete mechanics for moving between realms, with a solid backstory and explanations that will satisfy fantasy players.
4. A galaxy-spanning conspiracy with good guys and villains to fight, join, bribe, betray, hide from, and maybe defeat. 
Celestial Leviathan
View the Google Doc with more information about the worlds.
Sara and I (Aaron) started our journey with Dungeons & Dragons. Not only did we fall in love with the game, but the art of Jeff Easley, Keith Parkinson, Larry Elmore, and the great Frank Frazetta inspired us. We have them to thank for what we are doing today! D&D is such a huge part of our lives that everything we have now, including a happy marriage of 14 years, comes from and is because of a beloved game.
Since 2016, Jetpack7 has been on a mission to bring great art, creativity, and a whole lot of fun into the world. We have been fortunate to be a part of some well-known and loved titles since our start, such as Legends of Norrath, Just Cause 3, and digitally re-creating the 1980’s "painterly" look for the 25th anniversary of G.I. Joe.
In 2011 Wizards of the Coast approached our art studio, Conceptopolis, to help visualize 5th edition. Surprised to know that we were competing with larger and more venerable studios who had been in the industry for longer than ourselves, we remained confident and presented our work to WotC. Despite all obstacles and the intimidating competition, we landed the job!
It seemed fated that we would work on the same game that made us who we are now.
From 2011 to 2013, we produced over 300 pieces of art, some of which you have already seen if you have thumbed through the Monster Manual and Dungeon Master’s Guide for 5th edition.
Encouraged by this, we formed Jetpack7 in 2017 to bring our own passion for art and gaming to even more people. Having published comic books before, 5th edition presented us with the opportunity to get back into something we love to do. Our mission is to bring something fresh but familiar to a game we love so much, now that it’s being introduced to so many new players. D&D is enjoying an age of revival.
 However, we recognized something lacking. Except for some notable stand-outs, many of the more popular campaign settings produced for 5e are much the same setting.
With so many new players joining the fun and bringing their own fresh and unique worlds to the game, we saw a solution to this ‘sameness.’ In an effort to bring back the nostalgia of the early days of gaming with a fresh outlook, some new mechanics, and our own unique creative twists on the world’s greatest roleplaying game, we came up with Blackstorm Realms! It's a new way to draw all of your worlds together and create something truly unique and special!
 Ted Sikora of Nerd Immersion YouTube channel. Featured Contributor.
In 2014, Ted formed Nerd Immersion as a way to share his love for gaming and nerd culture with the world. With the release of 5th edition D&D, he shifted the focus of Nerd Immersion to D&D live streaming and D&D videos. Since then, the channel has streamed over 13 campaigns and released over 1000 D&D videos.

 Celeste Conowitch, Author, Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden. @dms_guild Adept.  https://celesteconowitch.com 
Celeste is a full-time RPG writer, podcast producer, and general content creator. She has published across the DMs Guild and worked with fine companies like Kobold Press. When not writing, you can find her creating her actual play D&D podcast Venture Maidens, or hosting D&D CommuniTEA on the Wizards of the Coast Twitch channel. Find her on Twitter @cconowitch or check out her work at www.celesteconowitch.com

 jim pinto, Writer: Legend of the Five Rings, Warlord, Protocol, Praxis, The Carcass, George’s Children and World’s Largest Dungeon.  Find him on the Post World Games Facebook page.

Aaron has been playing Dungeons & Dragons since there were yellow character sheets that didn't take to erasers very well... and has fond memories of THAC0.

What is 5th Edition?
The 5th edition’s Basic Rules, a free PDF containing complete rules for play and a subset of the player and GM content from the core rulebooks, was released on July 3, 2014. The Starter Set was released on July 15, featuring a set of pre-generated characters, a set of instructions for basic play, and the adventure module Lost Mine of Phandelver. The Player’s Handbook was released on August 19, 2014. The 5th Edition Monster Manual was released on September 30, 2014. The Dungeon Master’s Guide was released on December 9, 2014. The edition returns to having only three core rule books, with the Player’s Handbook containing most major races and classes.
The publication of the System Reference Document(SRD) under the Open Game License (OGL) allowed other companies to use the rules to create their own variants of Dungeons & Dragons™, providing that they did not use anything Wizards of the Coast considered trade dress or signature content, known as “product identity” under the terms of the OGL.


Shipping

IMPORTANT NOTE: "SHIPS ANYWHERE IN THE WORLD" does not mean free shipping. It's Kickstarter's way of saying that backers anywhere can support this project. If you are outside the US and getting physical rewards, see below. Please also be aware that you are responsible for import duties, taxes, and brokerage fees, and that we must comply with international law and cannot mark your reward as a gift or as a zero-value item.
REWARD FULFILLMENT: Soon after this campaign ends, we will ask you to fill out a survey if you have NOT purchased a physical product. When we receive physical product from printer(s), we will then send out another survey for our backers of the book that needs to be shipped.
IMPORTANT: Please let us know as soon as possible if you have any address changes.
Here is how PDFs are distributed:when a PDF reward is ready, we will put out a project update letting you know it is time to log on to your account on the Conceptopolis/Jetpack7 Shop and redeem your reward, which you will do for free with a coupon. The coupon code will be good for the email address associated with your kickstarter account only. If you have problems with this process, please email info@jetpack7.com
Physical products will be shipped upon our receipt of books. We guarantee a product will be in stock for you as one of your rewards for at least one year after the product's release date.
DOMESTIC SHIPPING: We offer USPS media mail shipping within the United States.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We successfully funded and fulfilled several Kickstarter projects; Gods and Goddesses in 2017, Masters and Minions in 2018, Legendary Dragons in 2019 and Gods and Goddesses: Redux in 2020.

Unforeseen challenges with Gods and Goddesses were delays associated with shipping books from overseas and delays in customs. We have since made vendor corrections and the process was much smoother, now working with a printer within the USA.

Other possible risks are scheduling the additional material from stretch goals that may push out the delivery schedule on those items, or that one of our primary contributors encounters a production delay. We're a small, but very experienced team with over 1000 unique projects delivered for dozens of toy and video game corporations. Such an event could possibly delay (but not prevent) publication, or delivery of product. Jetpack7 has no other Kickstarter projects outstanding. We have contributed and delivered content to nine successfully crowdfunded projects to date.

Thanks to everyone who participated in the Blackstorm Realms 28 page adventure survey.

We had 438 total votes—and the winner with 212 votes is... *drum roll*

Hi folks, it's survey time!
As you may already know, we are making a 28 page adventure for Blackstorm Realms and we want your input.
Please select from the options in the survey we set up here.

Greetings, intrepid adventurers!  

Here’s a quick note to let you all know that we’re still working hard on getting BSR closer to a published state for you all to enjoy! As of yesterday, Beta #9 left our outboxes, and we’re so happy to have backer participation in this part of the production process.  We're still looking for comments and feedback up until June 30th. So, beta backers, speak now or forever hold your peace. :)

Hi Folks,

We wanted to send out a quick update to let everyone know that Beta 07 of Blackstorm Realms has been sent out so be sure to check your email for the notification.

Greetings, adventurers!

We're deep in beta production of Blackstorm Realms, and excited to share something with you! We'd like to apologize as well. Making and sharing the beta with our beta backers is a whole lot of fun, but sometimes we get so wrapped up in the creative process that we forget that not everyone can see all the goodies that we're making in the background.
Hi Folks!

Hi Folks!
We wanted to give a quick update to let you know that the development of Blackstorm Realms is going along very well. We anticipate having the first Beta release very late 2020 or in January 2021, which is looking more realistic. We just want to make sure what we have is presentable and not a completely raw preview (even though I suspect some of you all may enjoy that haha).

Wow. What a campaign!

Thanks to everyone one of you who made Blackstorm Realms a reality. We truly, truly appreciate it—especially with everything going on in the world this year. It's hard to express how much your support means to our company and that you believe in what we do.

Not only are we getting 3 new settings...*best southern accent* We're going to space y'all!

campaign.story:
NINJA HIGH SCHOOL exploded on the indie comic scene in 1987 and was the   first original American manga series to make a big hit. Following the   adventures of Jeremy Feeple who is suddenly being chased by a ninja named Itchy-Koo and an alien princess named Asrial in the town of   Quagmire. Later his younger brother Ricky would pick up the mantel. For 175 issues it is one of the longest running OEL(Original English  Language) manga to exist and has  influenced many. So much so that fans  and readers began to submit  stories based on the NINJA HIGH SCHOOL  characters and story situations.  This lead the creator of NINJA HIGH  SCHOOL, BEN DUNN, to begin to  collect these stories into annuals or  YEARBOOKS. Thus began a 20 year  tradition.
Now for the first time ever, these stories are being collected in  what  will hopefully be a series to collect all the various stories that  take  place in the NINJA HIGH SCHOOL universe. Inside this collection are   the talents of many fans and readers. Some who have gone on to have   incredible comic careers.
This is a must for any NINJA HIGH SCHOOL or manga fan.
